column4: I just installed firefox 3.6. But every time I launch firefox I'm still running 3.5.8, or whatever comes with 9.10
I just installed firefox 3.6. But every time I launch firefox I'm still running 3.5.8, or whatever comes with 9.10
depeding on how you installed the 3.6  it may have a icon with a different name in th emenus.
I found a page online that told me what to type into the terminal to add a repo and install it, let me find you the link.
i tend to use the firefox-stable ppa i belive.
follow the ubuntu wiki pages. is the best bet.
I've already installed it. The only firefox that appears in my menu is the one that launches 3.5.8. Where would it have installed in the filesystem?
i doubt if thats goign to be easially done.. if its doable at all. and i can imagine that would cause lots of problems.
thers alternative indicator-applets for a lot of the old applets.
thats a compiz setting/plugin thats proberly disabled by default
many compiz plugins dont play well with Unity.
install ccsm and play with them  if you want.
so the super + tab animation won't work with Unity?
no idea. its not enabled by default..  notice if you hit the windows/super  keys. the launcher gives #'s to the icons.. the  super key has a lot of other things it does under unity.
Then I'll check out ccsm and use a different key combination. Thanks.
I just tried an apt-get for ccsm and terminal told me it was unable to locate
I just tried an apt-get for ccsm and terminal told me it was unable to locate
